cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly drifting west, then turning northwest and north toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to southeastern Louisiana coast near Morgan City/Atchafalaya delta

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle (hurricane watch); Shell Beach to the MS/AL border and Lake Pontchartrain (storm-surge watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle; Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Intracoastal City to Cameron (tropical-storm warning) plus Intracoastal City to Shell Beach (storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Louisiana coastline, including Plaquemines Parish, Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain, and areas westward to Intracoastal City
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–58 mph) likely; low chance (10%) of 50-kt (58+ mph) gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–6 ft possible along Plaquemines coastal areas and lower Mississippi River delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches possible with locally higher amounts up to 25 inches leading to life-threatening flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Friday night; significant river flooding potential along the Mississippi River.
